prompt.text: Hi! I'm LabAssistant. We'll wait here until both teammates are settled before we start the experiment.
Once you're both ready, we'll follow the wizard's clue together.
A friendly wizard tipped us off that substances A, B, C, and D react in a mysterious way. Your job is to uncover the full reaction and its stoichiometric coefficients using the virtual lab.
The stockroom has 1.00 M solutions of each reagent. Use the shared Google document for sketches, calculations, and rough plans. We collect it at the end.
Stage 1 goal: identify which substances are the reactants.
Coordinate before you test anything. Talk through a plan so both of you know how you'll probe the reactions.
When you both agree on next steps, type ready:stage1 in chat. Each teammate needs to send it so we can move on together.
Waiting for ready:stage1 from both of you. Give the signal when you're set.
Great. Record the reactants in your scratchpads, look over each other's notes, and discuss anything that differs. We'll move on shortly.
Stage 2: determine the complete reaction, including the stoichiometric coefficients.
Keep the conversation going. Share observations, propose candidate equations, and double-check each other before submitting.
Ready to tackle the final reaction? Each of you type ready:stage2 so we know you're set.
Submit your best answer as [REACTION_FORMAT]. You have up to three tries, so double-check the stoichiometry before you send it.
Listening for ready:stage2 from both teammates. Ping me when you're ready to finalize the reaction.
That matches the wizard's tip exactly! Nice work. Thanks for collaborating -- I'll collect your notes and close the session now.
Not quite there yet. You have [ATTEMPTS_LEFT] attempt(s) remaining. Revisit your notes and refine the equation together.
Thanks for giving it a go. Let's stop here and review the work you've recorded in the Google document so you can revisit the reaction offline. I'll close the session now.
